recipies.name: Basil Pesto
recipies.ingredient: 2 cups fresh basil leaves, packed (can sub half the basil leaves with baby spinach)1/2 cup freshly grated Romano or Parmesan-Reggiano cheese (about 2 ounces)1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil1/3 cup pine nuts (can sub chopped walnuts)3 garlic cloves, minced (about 3 teaspoons)Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
recipies.method: Place the basil leaves and pine nuts into the bowl of a food processor and pulse a several times.Add the garlic and Parmesan or Romano cheese and pulse several times more. While the food processor is running, slowly add the olive oil in a steady small stream. Adding the olive oil slowly, while the processor is running, will help it emulsify and help keep the olive oil from separating. Occasionally stop to scrape down the sides of the food processor.Stir in some salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.

recipies.name: Cheapest Veggie Pasta
recipies.ingredient: Ingredients: 1/2 lb pasta â€“ cooked 1 tbs oil, 3 garlic cloves â€“ minced 1/3 yellow onion 1 1/2 cups frozen broccoli 2/3 of the can of 15 oz tomato sauce (save the rest) any Italian-tasting dried spices you have on hand: 1 tbs oregano 1/2 tbs parsley 1/2 tbs basil
recipies.method: Saute onions and garlic in oil add broccoli and cook for 2-3 minutes Add sauce, spices and pasta and mix thoroughly.

recipies.name: Pumpkin Flax Granola
recipies.ingredient: 1 1/2 Pumpkin Flax Granola w/ 1 cup soy milk

recipies.name: Curry Chickpeas over brown rice
recipies.ingredient: 1 Can of Chickpeas, rinsed and drained 1/2 Cup of Diced Yellow Onion 1 15oz Can of Fire Roasted Tomatoes 2 Tablespoons of Curry Powder 1/2 Teaspoon of Cinnamon 1/2 Teaspoon of Cumin 1/2 Teaspoon of Ginger 2 Cloves of Garlic, minced 4 Kale Stalks, stem removed 1/8th Cup of Water
recipies.method:
Step 1
Preheat oven to 450f.
Step 2
Mix cinnnamon, cumin, ginger, and 1 tablespoon of the curry in a bowl. Toss chickpeas in seasoning.
Step 3
Place chickpeas on a non stick baking sheet. Cook for 15 minutes.
Step 4
While chickpeas are cooking heat garlic and onion in a non stick pan for 2 - 3 minutes.
Step 5
Add fire roasted tomatoes water, and 1 tablespoon of curry powder Cover and continue to cook.
Step 6
Place kale in a food processor, and pulse until kale is in small pieces.
Step 7
Add kale, and chickpeas to the curry and tomato mix. Let it simmer for 5 more minutes.
Step 8
Serve over rice or put it in a pita.

recipies.name: Red beans and rice
recipies.ingredient: 1 tablespoon olive oil 2 large cloves garlic, lightly crushed with the side of a knife blade and minced 1 large red onion, diced 1 stalk celery, diced 1 green bell pepper, stem and seeds removed and small diced 2 (1-pound) cans red kidney beans 1 teaspoon onion powder 1 teaspoon salt 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper 1 tablespoon hot sauce 2 1/2 cups chicken stock 1 cup white rice 1 tablespoon butter 1 tablespoon minced fresh cilantro leaves
recipies.method:
Total:30 minActive: 10 min Yield: 8 servings Level: Easy Nutrition Info HEALTHY
Heat olive oil over medium-high heat in a large saucepan. Saute garlic, onion, celery, and bell pepper until tender. Stir in kidney beans, onion powder, salt, pepper, and hot sauce. Reduce heat to low and let mixture simmer slowly while you cook the rice. Bring the chicken stock to a boil and stir in rice and butter. Return to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover and cook for 20 minutes without removing the lid. Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes.
Fold rice and beans gently together and transfer to a serving dish. Serve garnished with cilantro.

recipies.name: Oats for breakfast
recipies.ingredient: 1 1/2 cups oats, 1 cup non-dairy milk, cinnamon and brown sugar to taste, 1/8 cup seeds.

recipies.name: Veggie Pasta Soup
recipies.ingredient: 1 tbs oil, 2 cloves garlic â€“ minced 1/3 of your yellow onion â€“ diced 1 1/2 cup frozen broccol 1 carrot â€“ chopped the celery you have left â€“ chopped the rest of your chickpeas 1 cup pinto beans 1/2 bag mexican pasta shapes* (I put a link on the grocery list and it is just as tasty if you decide not to include it) 10 cups water 4 boullion handful cilantro â€“ chopped 1/2 tbs cumin
recipies.method: Saute onion and garlic, add carrot, frozen broccoli, celery and cook for 2-3 minutes on med-low temp. Add the rest of the ingredients and cook about 15 minutes.

recipies.name: Banana Kale Smoothie
recipies.ingredient: 2 ripe Bananas 1 cup Kale leaves, stems removed 1 cup non-dairy milk (any kind)
recipies.method: Place everything in a blender and process until completely smooth.

recipies.name: Mexican rice
recipies.ingredient: 1 cup medium grain rice 1 can tomato sauce 1/4 yellow onion, diced 2 cloves garlic, minced 1 tsp vegetable oil salt and pepper, to taste
recipies.method:
Step 1
Heat vegetable oil in a medium sized pan. Fry the uncooked rice until it's golden.
Step 2
Add onion and garlic and let cook until onions become translucent.
Step 3
Add tomato sauce and two cups of water, then stir with about a tsp of both salt and pepper.
Step 4
Bring water to a boil, cover the pan with a lid and bring down heat to a low temperature. Let it sit for 15-20 minutes at low heat.

recipies.name: Spiced Bean Dip
recipies.ingredient: 1 can pinto beans, drained 3 cloves garlic, chopped 1 medium onion, chopped 1/4 cup pepper of choice (anaheim, pasilla, jalapeno, etc), chopped 1 tsp sea salt 1 Tbsp chili powder 1 Tbsp nutritional yeast (optional) 1 tsp oregano 1/2 tsp fresh lemon or lime juice 1 Tbsp olive oil
recipies.method:
Step 1
In a skillet saute chopped onion, garlic, and peppers in the tablespoon of oil, 4-5 minutes until softened and fragrant.
Step 2
When veggies are beginning to brown, transfer them to bowl of food processor, add beans and all remaining ingredients. Puree for 2 minutes until rich and creamy.
Step 3
Transfer dip to a small pot and keep warm on stove until ready to serve.

recipies.name: Potato Tacos with Mexican Rice and
recipies.ingredient: tomato sauce cilantro 1/3 of an onion.
recipies.method:
For the tacos (feeding three people), I boiled five peeled and chopped russet potatoes.
Once they were boiled and soft, I drained and placed them back in the pot, and mashed them seasoned salt, to taste. For just yourself, Iâ€™d say do two potatoes. I used the corn tortillas (I fried mine, but you definitely donâ€™t have to) and we each had three tacos. I garnished the tacos with a diced tomato, the rest of the lettuce and an avocado that I had from last week (it was the only time I used something not on the list).
With the Mexican rice, I followed the recipe but I used 1/3 of my onion, my leftover tomato sauce, and added a handful of cilantro before I let it steam. And with the Bean Dip, I only used 1/3 of an onion.

recipies.name: Plain yogurt
recipies.ingredient: 1 quart whole milk 2 tbs yogurt (for starter)
recipies.method: bring milk to 195 f let cool to 110 f in a separate bowl mix 2 tbs yogurt culture with cup of milk mix in with rest of milk keep warm for 5 hrs
